item.title: R to @seanbgoneill: Hey look, the 90s were an exciting, cosmopolitan time - nothing was too new or too exotic for us
item.dc:creator: @danhancox
item.description: Hey look, the 90s were an exciting, cosmopolitan time - nothing was too new or too exotic for us

item.title: R to @danhancox: Also.. my mind is boggling thinking about how completely unimaginable this would have seemed to my one friend who came out at school, and was viciously and violently bullied... section 28 still in place then ofc. Genuinely moving to see
item.dc:creator: @danhancox
item.description: Also.. my mind is boggling thinking about how completely unimaginable this would have seemed to my one friend who came out at school, and was viciously and violently bullied... section 28 still in place then ofc. Genuinely moving to see

item.title: R to @danhancox: Meanwhile the students seem to be drinking coffee in the new branch of Pret, lmao. Next door to Pret, what was the Spoons is now a gastropub with table service, and next to that, what was Iceland is now an organic supermarket called As Nature Intended
item.dc:creator: @danhancox
item.description: Meanwhile the students seem to be drinking coffee in the new branch of Pret, lmao. Next door to Pret, what was the Spoons is now a gastropub with table service, and next to that, what was Iceland is now an organic supermarket called As Nature Intended

item.title: Today in you can't go home again news: here's my secondary school's "new food offer". The 'offer' when I was there was pizza (thick wodge of dough with thin veneer of red, plus rubber cheese of indeterminate origin), chips, or for people into fusion cuisine... pizza and chips
item.dc:creator: @danhancox

item.title: Shout out to the two lads in the Blackfriars bike lane at 10.30pm last night who were singing Bella Ciao when we were stopped at the lights, and when I commended them for it, said something I didn't quite hear about antifascism, called me comrade and gave me a fistbump. V cute
item.dc:creator: @danhancox

item.title: Priti Patel's draconian new Policing Bill has been used by the Met on day 1 - on day 1! - to stop a protest on the grounds that it is "noisy" https://www.lbc.co.uk/news/police-swoop-stop-brexit-mans-speaker-under-new-law-banning-noisy-protest/

item.title: RT by @danhancox: today the Police Bill comes into force. This means that no protest can now be - too noisy - too long - too inconvenient 'Charged' by @moraglivingst and @MattFoot2 sets out how the police have tried to suppress protest in collusion with the Home office for 40 years. @VersoBooks
item.dc:creator: @leohollis
item.description:
today the Police Bill comes into force. This means that no protest can now be
- too noisy
- too long
- too inconvenient
'Charged' by @moraglivingst and @MattFoot2 sets out how the police have tried to suppress protest in collusion with the Home office for 40 years. @VersoBooks
